thread.title: Anti-ageing Thai fish curry

author: Elizabeth Peyton-Jones
title: Anti-ageing Thai fish curry
text: Lighter than Indian fish curry, this is a nice dish for summer. The spices liven up the digestion. SERVES 2 INGREDIENTS 1-2 tsp green Thai curry paste, to taste (make your own or buy it) 1 lemon grass stalk, trimmed and thinly sliced 75ml organic coconut milk 100g aubergine, chopped into cubes 3 kaffir lime leaves, shredded 2 garlic cloves, crushed 2½cm root ginger, finely chopped or grated ¼ red pepper, thinly sliced ¼ orange pepper, thinly sliced 100g sweetcorn, shaved from the cob 150ml vegetable stock Pinch of Himalayan or Celtic salt 2 pieces of white fish (haddock, monkfish, red snapper, plaice), chopped into bite-sized pieces Handful of chopped coriander METHOD Fry the curry paste and lemon grass in the coconut milk until the mixture is thick and very aromatic. Add the aubergine, lime leaves, garlic and ginger, cover and simmer, but do not overcook. Add the peppers and sweetcorn and cook for a few minutes. Add the stock a little at a time, keeping the thickness of the curry. Add the salt. Simmer for a while, then place the fish on top, cover and steam until cooked. Sprinkle with coriander and serve. Cook Yourself Young by Elizabeth Peyton-Jones is published by Quadrille priced £14.99.
